intro: Crupina vulgaris proles alpestris, commonly known as the alpine crupina, is a perennial flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens as an ornamental plant.
